document.docAuthor: Zhang, Feng, Fu, Jianying & Zhu, Mingsheng
document.docTitle: Systaria hainanensis Zhang, Fu & Zhu, 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: First report of the sac spider genus Systaria Simon (Araneae: Clubionidae) from China: Systaria hainanensis sp. nov. and Systaria mengla (Song & Zhu, 1994) comb. nov.

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First report of the sac spider genus Systaria Simon (Araneae: Clubionidae) from China: Systaria hainanensis sp. nov. and Systaria mengla (Song & Zhu, 1994) comb. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype male, CHINA : Hainan Province, Wuzhishan City, Mt. Wuzhi, Shuiman Town [
18.81 °N
,
109.54 °E
],
16 August 2007
, Feng Zhang leg.; paratype
1 female
, same data as holotype ( MHBU ).
Etymology. The species name is an adjective in apposition derived from the type locality.

Description. Male ( holotype ). Total body length 8.19 ; cephalothorax 3.74 long, 2.61 wide; abdomen 4.45 long, 2.16 wide. Carapace (
Fig. 6
) light yellow, darker in eye area; longitudinal ovoid, cephalic area relatively broad; fovea longitudinal and distinct, long, occupying over one seventh of carapace length. Eye group width more than two third of carapace width. From dorsal view AER slightly recurved in dorsal view; and PER distinctly procurved and longer than AER ( Figs 3, 6 ). AME enlarged and dark, eye diameters: AME 0.13 , ALE 0.09 , PME 0.08 , PLE 0.07 ; eye interdistances: AME–AME 0.18 , AME–ALE 0.14 , PME – PME 0.22 , PME –PLE 0.15 , ALE–PLE 0.12 ; MOA 0.28 long, anterior width 0.30 , posterior width 0.29 . Clypeal height 0.13 , almost equal to the diameter of AME. Chilum distinct triangular sclerite. Chelicerae (
Fig. 7
) moderately long, brown, with three promarginal teeth, median one largest, and two widely spaced retromarginal teeth. Endites and labium yellowish-brown; endites longer than wide, widest anteriorly, and a tuft of setae prolaterally. Labium slightly longer than wide (
Fig. 4
), tip rounded and with several setae, invaginated at postero-lateral corners. Sternum light brown, shield-shaped, not rebordered, with sclerotised extensions reaching towards each coxa and between coxae I and II, II and III, III and IV; anterior margin truncate and posterior margin not extending between coxae IV, only slightly narrower in front than in the middle. Legs light brown, tarsi with two dentate claws and conspicuous claw tufts (
Fig. 2
), trochanters deeply notched. Leg spination: femora: I d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , r0- 0-2 ; II d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , r0- 0-1 ; III d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 0-1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 0- 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; tibiae: I
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; II
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; III d 0-1 -0, p 1 - 1 -0, r 2 - 2 - 2 ,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; IV d 0-1 -0, p 1 - 1 -0, r 1 - 1 -0,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; metatarsi: I
v 1
-0-0; II
v 1 - 1
- 1 ; III p 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1-2 ,
v 1
- 0-1 ; IV p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 2 - 2 - 2 ,
v 1 - 1
- 1 . Leg formula: 4123 (
Table 1
).

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Leg measurements of
Systaria hainanensis
sp. nov .
, male.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female ( paratype ). Carapace colour, eye arrangement, abdominal coloration as for male, but carapace and abdomen with different shape than male ( Figs 1, 6 ). Total length 10.70 ; cephalothorax 4.90 long, 3.42 wide; abdomen 5.80 long, 3.15 wide. Eye diameters: AME 0.15 , ALE 0.12 , PME 0.11 , PLE 0.10 ; eye interdistances: AME–AME 0.18 , AME–ALE 0.15 , PME – PME 0.22 , PME –PLE 0.17 , ALE–PLE 0.13 ; MOA 0.25 long, anterior width 0.36 , posterior width 0.35 . Clypeal height 0.14 , almost equal to the diameter of AME. Chelicerae with three promarginal and two retromarginal teeth. Endites, labium and sternum as for male holotype . Leg spination: femora: I d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 -0, r0- 0-2 ; II d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 0-2 -0, r 0-1 - 2 ; III d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 0-1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , r0- 0-1 ; tibiae: I
v 2 - 2
-0; II v 0-2 -0; III p 1 - 1 -0, r 1 - 1 -0,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; IV p 1 - 1 -0, r 1 - 1 -0,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; metatarsi: II
v 1
-0-0; III p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1-2 ,
v 2
- 0-2 ; IV p 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1-2 ,
v 2 - 2
- 2 . Leg formula: 4123 (
Table 2
).
